intro: Thesium scabriflorum, commonly known as the roughflower thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their ornamental value. The plant is characterized by its wiry stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Thesium scabriflorum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
